incidents.name: Degraded stability of static proxy groups

incident_updates.body:
We experienced a short incident during which the stability of Apify's static proxy groups (StaticUS1 and StaticUS3) was degraded. Default data center proxy groups were not affected by this incident. 

Problems were resolved in about 30 minutes. We are monitoring the situation to make sure that the situation is permanently resolved.

incidents.name: Increased error rate and latency across all services

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The problem was fixed on the AWS cloud side. Everything is back to a normal state, and elevated error rates are resolved. 

The whole Apify platform stayed operational throughout the incident, but the elevated error rates of our API caused a performance drop. This may have caused some Actor runs to fail. In such cases, you can resurrect them (https://docs.apify.com/platform/actors/running/runs-and-builds#resurrection-of-finished-run), and the runs will continue from the point of failure.
As the cloud provider has issues with identity access management, the error rate of all operations is higher than usual, resulting in Actors' degraded performance.
Due to an issue at our cloud service provider, most of our services are experiencing increased error rates and latencies. We are investigating the issue and will attempt to mitigate the impact.

incidents.name: Platform is fully operational, status page is down

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are only experiencing problems with the Status Page itself, so everything is displayed as down. But the Apify platform including all the components is fully operational.
This incident has been resolved.

Apify Residential Proxy service is down for many different countries. Problems started at about 9:45 UTC and are caused by one of our providers, traffic is being re-routed alternatively way and the service should recover in a couple of minutes.

incidents.name: Outage of the French residential proxy

incident_updates.body: There was a short outage of the residential proxy with the country selection France. The problems lasted for about 15 minutes. No other countries were affected. The problem is fixed, and we are monitoring the state.
This incident has been resolved.
The problem with the US region is fixed. We are monitoring the situation to make sure that the issue won't re-appear.
We are experiencing partial downtime of our residential proxy service. Only the requests with the country set to "us" are affected. We are identifying the problem.

incident_updates.body:
Small percentage of actor runs could not be started and new actors could not be created from templates.
We have identified the issue and deployed a fix. This incident lasted 17 minutes.
There was no data loss. All the actors may have been restarted. Actors already running were not affected.
This incident has been resolved.

We are sorry for the inconvenience caused. Problems were happening between 00:00 UTC and 6:30 UTC, causing residential proxy workloads to fail. We will be launching changes to our residential proxy service that will mitigate similar issues in the future.
A fix has been implemented, and the residential proxy is back up. We will keep monitoring the system. Other proxy types were not affected.
Apify residential proxy service is experiencing an outage due to a problem with one of our providers. We are working on a recovery.

incidents.name: Actor runtime unavailable for about 5 minutes

incident_updates.body: Due to an abnormally slow switch between the primary and replica of our database clusters, the worker machines that the host actor runs got restarted. The accumulated workload caused some runs to be delayed by about 3-5 minutes. Runs continued normally with no data loss but runs with a low timeout may have timed out.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
The performance has been restored and is under monitoring.
The API of the performance is degraded. The root cause has been identified and we are currently working on a fix. The platform remains fully operational.

components.description: Back-end services running at https://api.apify.com

incident_updates.body:
Due to an increased load and delayed scaling the performance of some services was degraded for short periods of time during the past 30 minutes  

This mainly affects the API response time and so the speed of Apify actors. There was no data loss or service disruption, but the overall performance was degraded at different levels.

The underlying issue has been addressed, and the performance has been restored. We are implementing measures so that this won't occur again.
Issue has been resolved. We are monitoring the situation to beware of further disruptions.
We are experiencing an outage of residential proxies caused by a downtime of one of our providers. We are monitoring the situation and working with our partner on recovery.

incident_updates.body: We experienced a temporary degradation of the API performance while the rest of the system was operating normally.
This incident has been resolved.

We have identified the issue and implemented a fix. All datacenter proxy groups should be back to usual performance. We will continue monitoring the proxy status.

If your actor uses the "auto" proxy configuration, it could have experienced reduced performance due to higher error rate. If it uses a BUYPROXIES proxy group directly, it could have failed connecting to the proxy server.
Some datacenter proxy groups of Apify Proxy are having an outage. We have identified the issue and we are implementing a fix.

incident_updates.body:
During an infrastructure update, we had to restart all the machines that the host actor runs. This restart took longer than expected and machines were unavailable for about 2-5 minutes. All actors were paused and continued running unless the timeout was hit.

We are sorry for any inconvenience caused. We will now focus on both smoothening these updates and speeding up of restart times to minimize such disruptions.
This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are continuing to monitor the issue.

There was a short interval of downgraded performance of our API, which caused some actor runs with a short timeout to fail. There was no data loss.
We are experiencing a drop in performance of our API. We are currently investigating this issue and we will post an update soon.

incidents.name: Partial outage of Apify platform due to the AWS incident

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The whole system is finally fully recovering, the problems started at 20:45 UTC, and since that some actors might have been paused or timing out. We are sorry for the inconvenience caused.

We are experiencing an outage of our cloud provider Amazon Web Services (AWS) with the AWS SQS and AWS Lambda services we depend on to be completely down. Also, AWS EC2 APIs are having a very high error rate. For more info see:
- https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status
- https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30619871

Due to these problems, we are not able to maintain a high enough pool of servers and many actors are delayed and are timing out. We are in monitoring the situation and minimizing the impact on our customers. Our APIs are operating normally.

components.name: Actors
components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incident_updates.body:
We experienced a slowdown of Apify API between 9:20 and 9:50 at different levels. All systems were operational during the incident only the API performance was affected.

Everything is back to normal, we identified a cause of stress on the API backend and will implement a rate limit to prevent such incidents in the future.

We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.

incidents.name: Degreaded performance of the Apify platform

incident_updates.body:
**The root cause**

* The original problem was triggered by an internal Apify user running an extreme amount of actor runs in parallel. A suboptimal DB query used in our job allocator overloaded the CPU of the database kernel, and our central database slowed down under the critical value, which caused a cascade effect.
* After we recovered the system, the buffer used for our dataset API did not fully recover, which caused the performance issues of the dataset API endpoint that persisted until the full recovery.

**Next steps and new measures**

* We discovered the suboptimal query caused the database to be overloaded. This is fixed at the time of writing. We plan to publish an engineering blog post on this topic.
* We also found the bottleneck that protected dataset API from an automated recovery, and the fix is in progress.
* We are currently analyzing and testing other system components to ensure that they are elastic enough.
* We will apply new platform measures and limits to beware of the original trigger of the incident. These limits will affect no users, but they are strict enough to protect workloads from accidental overload.

We are sorry for any inconvenience and problems caused by this incident.
We are closing the incident. We will publish an update on this issue and future measures to prevent these problems in the future.

All systems are back up and fully operational.

In summary:
- The initial outage happened during the period 17:30 UTC and 20:00 UTC.
- Since then, we recovered the actor runtime, but the dataset push items API endpoint had performance problems, the rest of the platform operated normally.
- To prevent a data loss, between 0:30 and 1:00, we had to restart most of our servers during the recovery process. This caused runs to be on hold, and only the runs with a short timeout may have timed out.
- Thanks to the recovery process, we prevented a potential data loss.

This incident is unrelated to the previous one, and the root cause is different. We consider this an incident of critical severity, and we will update you next week with detailed information on the root cause and our measures to prevent these problems in the future.
We are currently working on full recovery of the system. Some parts have to be restarted which can make some actors run longer than usual.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have identified the issue and the system has mostly recovered. The performance of datasets might still be affected.

We are experiencing issues with our database provider causing the high error rate of Apify API and Console. We are investigating the root cause and will keep you up to date. 
We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.

incident_updates.body:
We experienced the Actor runtime slowdown similar to the recent incident from Saturday 5th. Unfortunately, the newly implemented alerting mechanism failed and the actors were slowed down at various levels during the past about 10 hours.

The recovery mechanism did work and we quickly recovered. Everything now works at a normal speed.

Affect on users:
- Many of the actors running between about 00:00 and 10:15 GMT+1 have been running slower than usual.
- This mainly affects the short-running actors as these are likely to time out.
- The actual reason for the slowdown is a high error rate resulting in a higher number of API call retries. The high number of retries are caused by network problems.

We finally collected enough data and worked on a long-term solution. We apologize for any inconvenience caused and will update you on the progress shortly.

-------------------------------------------------

Update (2022/08/02 19:07 GMT+1): We are still working on a final solution but have a recovery system in place to beware of this recurrence of this issue .
This incident has been resolved.
We have identified the issue and deployed a fix. We are continuing to monitor our systems for any further disruptions.

Some actor runs might be taking longer than usual or not be finishing. We are currently investigating this issue, and we apologize for any inconvenience caused and will update you on the progress shortly.

The service provider has implemented a fix, which has resolved the actor builds outage. We will closely monitor our platform for any further disruptions.

We are experiencing an outage of actor builds on the Apify platform due to a partial outage of one of our service providers (Docker Hub). We are trying to minimize the impact on our customers.

Actor builds on the Apify platform are currently failing, however, the ability to run already built actors is unaffected. There is no data loss.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: External services - Braintree Payment Gateway API
External services - Braintree United States Processing
External services - npm, Inc. Registry Reads

incident_updates.body:
After about 8 hours the whole system is finally recovering as we found the way how to bypass still broken AWS services.

Current state:
- All the Apify components are now fully operational including Actors, Scheduler, API, ...
- Performance may still be degraded but it's recovering
- We are monitoring the situation and will keep you informed in a case of change

Summary of the impact:
- Since the start of the incident both actors and API had a higher error rate and degraded performance that escalated to an almost complete outage during the past 1-2 hours
- Scheduler was down for the past 1-2 hours
- Many operations such as abort did not work for many of the runs
- No data loss

Root cause:
- Outage of our cloud provider Amazon Web Services (AWS).
- AWS service is still not fully recovered.
- For more information see: https://status.aws.amazon.com/#ME_block

incident_updates.body: Amazon Web Services are finally recovering but some of the services we critically depend on are still not fully operational. Actors and API are still degraded and we experience a complete outage of the scheduler.

For more info on Amazon Web Services outage see https://status.aws.amazon.com/

incidents.name: Elevated error rate and degrated performance of a key-value store

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Due to the increased error rate of AWS S3, our underlying storage, the PUT requests to key-value have an error rate of about 3% and performance is degraded. As the majority of requests are typically done using Apify API Client for Javascript with exponential backoff the actors should not be affected by the error rate.

components.name: Console (console.apify.com)
components.description: Application running at console.apify.com

components.name: Actors
components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

components.name: Webhooks
components.description: Webhooks provide an easy and reliable way to configure the Apify platform to carry out an action when a certain system event occurs. For example, you can use webhooks to start another actor when an actor run finishes or fails.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Due to a delay in the startup of our worker servers, actors stopped running for about 3-5 minutes. After this delay, all runs got back into the running state and continued working. This incident has caused some timeouts for runs with a timeout under this period.

components.name: Actors
components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Docker Hub as recovered and actors can be built again. We are monitoring the situation.

Due to the outage of Docker Hub, the actors cannot be built at the moment as all the base actor Docker images are hosted there. For details see https://status.docker.com/pages/history/533c6539221ae15e3f000031

This affects only builds not runs. Actors can be run as usual both via API and scheduler.

components.name: Actors
components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incident_updates.body: We experienced a degraded performance of some Apify Proxy servers for multiple periods of 9th April 2021. Some percentage of requests to Apify Proxy may have timed out as the processing was slower than usual. The problem is fixed and we are monitoring the situation.

The problem has been identified and fixed. All the datasets are readable again.

We are monitoring the API and will extend the test suite to ensure this won't reappear in the future.
Due to an error in datasets API, some of the datasets updated between 14:30 and 16:30 UTC are unreadable via API. No data are lost. We are working on a fix to make them available again.

components.name: API (api.apify.com)
components.description: Back-end services running at https://api.apify.com

incidents.name: Outage of Apify Actors and API

incident_updates.body: Due to a short database outage, all the worker servers were restarted along with currently running actors. Actor runs were restarted in few minutes after the outage. Apify API was partially unavailable during this period and some API calls may have failed if not retried. The issue is solved.

incidents.name: Actor runs are not starting up

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Due to a system error, new worker servers for actor runs are not being spined up. As a result of this, the actor platform is under-scaled and new actor runs are not starting up.

components.name: Actors
components.description: Actors are serverless cloud programs running on Apify that can perform arbitrary computing jobs, such as send an email or crawl a website with millions of pages.

incidents.name: Bug in Put Record in the Key-value store API

incident_updates.body: Due to a system error from 15:05 UTC to 16:10 UTC, API calls to put records into a key-value store occasionally failed with 401 status code (token-not-provided). The error affected users using the Apify JavaScript Client version v1.0.0 or later. After finding the error, we immediately rolled back to the previous version.

Due to a technical problem, our mailing system was not working correctly and emails were not sent between 00:30 and 6:00 UTC. This affects for example verification emails but also apify/send-mail actor. This problem is fixed and we will take steps to beware of this in the future.
